title: Fed Steps Up Deliberations on Shrinking Its $9 Trillion Asset Portfolio
sub_head: Policy makers have indicated a potential unwind of asset holdings this year but have yet to iron out specifics
body:
Federal Reserve officials are set to resume discussions this week over how fast they will shrink their nearly $9 trillion bond portfolio when the time comes, which would serve as a tool for tightening monetary policy as they try to curb high inflation.
Officials are on track at their meeting Tuesday and Wednesday to approve a final tranche of bond purchases, allowing them to end the stimulus program by Marchâ€”when they are likely to raise interest rates to cool the economy, according to their recent public comments.
